message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.IR 

This paper is about improving the Natural Language Understanding (NLU) module of digital assistants to allow users to teach them new tasks through natural language. This falls under the category of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Artificial Intelligence (AI), which are covered by cs.CL and cs.AI respectively. The paper also discusses the need for the system to be adaptive to novel intents, which involves machine learning and could be categorized under cs.LG. Additionally, the paper focuses on user interaction and adaptation, which could be classified under Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC). Finally, the paper discusses the use of semantic similarity evaluation to discriminate between learned intents, which could be categorized under Information Retrieval (cs.IR).
